page.title: 17Policing the Area
page.content: Bedlington comes under the Wansbeck subdivision of Northumbria Police. The Police station is now closed after 4.30pm. A policy is being implemented whereby soon there will be a balance between the number of patrol cars and the number of men on the beat. When surplus officers are available, the Front Street is patrolled on foot, and cars cover the rest of the area. Extra police are used at certain times - eg. at Lucy's Night Club at weekends. The public are very law-abiding, and relations are good even in the wake of the Miners' strike. Crime has increased - most crime is committed by children and youths. The detection rate has gone up by 48%. There is a spate of car thefts and some solvent abuse. Police warn people to leave no signs that they are out. Police establish links with schools.
